file_content.text: You did my buddy a good turn. Thanks.
Well, well, well. Look who's here! You're the one that saved my buddy Oren!
Without you, that man'd still be hanging in Fa'athra's trophy room. He's got a few scrapes, but he--he's doing pretty well.
The galaxy can use another Jedi-killing bounty hunter.
Glad to hear it.
Just doing the job you hired me for.
All in a day's work.
It's what I do best.
Well, thank you anyhow.
The reward sounded good.
It's all about the money.
Well, I appreciate it.
Here's your credits. And I'll tell you what--once Oren's sight is all back, we'll buy you a drink. A couple of drinks.
You'll have to make it Jawa juice.
Non-alcoholic, please.
Well, er, that's certainly an unusual choice. But suit yourself--and watch yourself out there, now.
No problem.
Ha! You're not a bad sort. Watch yourself out there, now.
I'm a little busy at the moment, but maybe I'll take you up on it later.
Not right now.
Ah, well, all right then. But you're okay in my book.
I haven't heard a word from my buddy, which I take to mean you haven't saved him yet. Get over to Fa'athra's, and hurry!
Hey, you there--you look like my kind of person, if you know what I mean.
If this is leading to you paying me money, then yes.
Someone who likes credits?
Oh, dear me, Burnok, can you pick 'em out of a crowd or what? What I mean to say is, I had a feeling you had a mind for business.
Appearances can be deceiving.
I wouldn't be so sure.
There's not a soul on Hutta who is who he says he is. But don't you worry--I won't be asking any... prying questions.
I don't know what you mean.
Well, as I am currently in the market for a person with a good bit of business-like sense, I mean that you look like just that kind of person.
You're not exactly my type.
Uh, not really.
Heh! If your gunnery's as good as your wit, we'll be in business then!
I have a little job that needs doing, with a big reward for the doer. My buddy's been taken captive, see, and I'm looking to buy a rescue.
What makes you think I'm in the rescue business?
Who says I'm selling?
I think you know good business when you see it.
Is this buddy of yours anyone important?
What's so special about him?
Depends on who you ask.
Buy, huh?
It'll be enough money, I promise--with a bonus if you keep a low profile.
My buddy Oren's a world-class Mandalorian Jedi killer. He went into Fa'athra's on account he heard the Hutt was hoarding some kind of treasure.
But he ended up frozen in carbonite and hanging as a trophy on Fa'athra's wall. I was hoping you could help him down.
Frozen in carbonite? Care to explain that?
Carbonite?
It's, well, it's--he's stuck solid in a brick of carbonite in a kind of suspended animation, just waiting to be thawed.
Some "world-class fighter" he turned out to be.
So he's not that impressive.
Oh, that crazy Hutt--he's such a prankster.
Fa'athra's so funny.
A double-crosser, more like--it was Fa'athra's own lieutenant who told Oren about the treasure. A regular trap--but what's done's done.
I expect he's hanging in Fa'athra's gallery. Unfortunately, something about being frozen like my buddy's been makes you lose your sight for a spell.
But you just thaw him out, and I'll come in after you've cleared the path. I'm not exactly a fighter, see, but my buddy's sickness isn't your problem. Deal?
Okay.
I could use the credits.
For the money.
Anything to stick it to a Hutt.
I'll do it to spite Fa'athra.
Great. Thanks. And try to be stealthy about it.
No sense getting all of Fa'athra's guards breathing down our necks. Good luck.
Sorry--I don't think you're gonna do me much good.
